briefdescription.para: Contains all the non zero (NZ) elements.
column index of the NZ elements
for each row contains the index of the first NZ in the previous two arrays
size of the memory allocated for m_values and m_innerIndices
Insert a new element at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para:
It returns the index in m_values of the inserted element
row
row of the new element
col
column of the new element
value
value to be inserted
index in m_values of the inserted element

briefdescription.para: Check if the element at row-col is present in the matrix.

detaileddescription.para: If it is present the function returns true and the index in the out parameter index, otherwise it returns false and index will contain the index of the next element in the value array

parameterdescription.para: if found contains the index, if not the index of the next element

simplesect.para: true if the value has been found

briefdescription.para: Creates an empty sparse matrix.
Creates a zero sparse matrix with the specified dimensions.
Default destructor.
Returns the number of nonzero elements in this sparse matrix.

simplesect.para: the number of non zero elements

briefdescription.para: Resize the matrix to the specified new dimensions.

simplesect.para: the content of the matrix is not preserved in any case
this function may perform memory allocation

parameterdescription.para: the new number of rows of this matrix
the new number of columns of this matrix

briefdescription.para: Resize the matrix to the specified new dimensions.

simplesect.para: the content of the matrix is not preserved in any case
this function may perform memory allocation

parameterdescription.para: the new number of rows of this matrix
the new number of columns of this matrix
information on the NNZ for each column (row), used to reserve memory in advance. It depends on the storage ordering

briefdescription.para: Set the sparse matrix to be zero.

simplesect.para: In C++11 it is not guaranteed that this function performs no memory allocation, depending on the standard library implementation.

briefdescription.para: Sets the content of this sparse matrix to the content of triplets.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not set the dimensions of the matrix which must be set beforehand. If the dimensions are wrong the behaviour is undefined.

simplesect.para: duplicate elements in triplets will be summed up
the content of this matrix will be totally overwritten
this function performs a copy of the triplets parameter so that it does not modify the input parameter. Use setFromTriplets(iDynTree::Triplets& triplets) if you accept to have triplets modified.

parameterdescription.para: triplets containing the non zero elements

briefdescription.para: Sets the content of this sparse matrix to the content of triplets.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not set the dimensions of the matrix which must be set beforehand. If the dimensions are wrong the behaviour is undefined.

simplesect.para: duplicate elements in triplets will be summed up
the content of this matrix will be totally overwritten
this function modifies the input parameter triplets. Use setFromConstTriplets(const iDynTree::Triplets& triplets) if you want to preserve the content of triplets.

parameterdescription.para: triplets containing the non zero elements

briefdescription.para: Access operation to the element of the matrix identified by row-col.

simplesect.para: this method is slow as it has to look for the proper index (it performs a linear search)
the value at the specified row and column

briefdescription.para: Access operation to the element of the matrix identified by row-col.

simplesect.para: this method is slow as it has to look for the proper index (it performs a linear search)
if no elements are found, this method insert a zero value at the specified position
reference to the value at the specified row and column

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of rows of the matrix.

simplesect.para: the number of rows

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of columns of the matrix.

simplesect.para: the number of columns

briefdescription.para: Returns a textual description of the matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
If true is passed, the whole matrix (with also zero elements) is printed Default to false
fullMatrix
true to return the full matrix, false for only the non zero elements. Default to false
a textual representation of the matrix

briefdescription.para: Sparse Matrix class.

detaileddescription.para: This class uses the Compressed Column (Row) Storage scheme (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sparse_matrix#Compressed_sparse_row_.28CSR.2C_CRS_or_Yale_format.29) which is compatible with the format used in the Eigen library (by using Map).
